p: Hepatitis B vaccination of infants, blood safety programmes and universal precautions in healthcare settings have already greatly reduced HBV and HCV incidence. However, morbidity and mortality are still increasing. What is further needed is to prioritise the full implementation of timely HBV vaccinations, drug addiction therapies, safe injection equipÂ­ment and HCV treatment for persons who inject drugs, and assured access to testing, care and treatment for those with HBV and HCV.
